description: Create a profile with the name 'xyz'.
Add a component to the profile.
The number of components are shown as text. Below, the list of components will be shown as table (rich element).
The used component should be capable to compute a table of results (rich element).
input: What is the capital of Germany?

description: After a successful question there should be a RDF graph available.
Remove the one component from the profile with the name xyz.
input: remove all components from the profile xyz.

description: Now, no component is available anymore. Hence, the textual response should mention that no components are in the profile. A rich element is pointing additionally to the tutorial.
input: What is the capital of Germany?

description: Add a first component to the profile.
input: add NED DBpedia-Spotlight to profile xyz

description: Add a second component to the profile.
The configured profile should be capable of answering a question.
input: What is the capital of France?

description: After a successful question there should be a RDF graph available.
The number of components are shown as text. Below, the list of components will be shown as table (rich element).
Delete the whole profile. The response is just a text informing about that the deletion was done.
